com.stormpath.sdk.directory

Interface PasswordPolicy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Resource, Saveable

    public interface PasswordPolicy
extends Resource, Saveable
    A PasswordPolicy resource is used to configure different aspects of the restrictions on passwords for accounts associated with the parent Directory.
    Since:
    1.0.RC4

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      EmailStatus getResetEmailStatus()
      Returns the Reset Email's status.
      ModeledEmailTemplateList getResetEmailTemplates()
      Returns the ModeledEmailTemplateList collection holding the set of email templates to be used when requesting a password reset operation.
      EmailStatus getResetSuccessEmailStatus()
      Returns the Reset Success Email's status.
      UnmodeledEmailTemplateList getResetSuccessEmailTemplates()
      Returns the ModeledEmailTemplateList collection holding the set of email templates available when notifying about a successful password reset operation.
      int getResetTokenTtlHours()
      Return the time-to-live (in hours) for the reset password token.
      PasswordStrength getStrength()
      Return the PasswordStrength resource to configure the password strength policy.
      PasswordPolicy setResetEmailStatus(EmailStatus status)
      Specifies whether the Reset Email Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory.
      PasswordPolicy setResetSuccessEmailStatus(EmailStatus status)
      Specifies whether the Reset Success Email Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory.
      PasswordPolicy setResetTokenTtlHours(int resetTokenTtl)
      Specifies the amount of time (in hours) that a reset token will remain valid.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.stormpath.sdk.resource.Resource

        getHref

      • Methods inherited from interface com.stormpath.sdk.resource.Saveable

        save

    • Method Detail

      • getResetTokenTtlHours

        int getResetTokenTtlHours()
        Return the time-to-live (in hours) for the reset password token.
        Returns:
        the time-to-live (in hours) for the reset password token.

      • setResetTokenTtlHours

        PasswordPolicy setResetTokenTtlHours(int resetTokenTtl)
        Specifies the amount of time (in hours) that a reset token will remain valid. Once that time has passed, the token gets invalidated.

        Defaults to 24 hrs. Must be a positive integer, less than 169 (i.e. 0 < resetTokenTtl < 169). 168 hours equals 7 days.

        Parameters:
        resetTokenTtl - how long (in hours) a reset token can remain active until it is used.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getResetEmailStatus

        EmailStatus getResetEmailStatus()
        Returns the Reset Email's status.

        An disabled indicates that the Reset Password Workflow is disabled. Therefore, the reset email will not be sent to the account trying to reset its password.

        Returns:
        the Reset Email's status.

      • setResetEmailStatus

        PasswordPolicy setResetEmailStatus(EmailStatus status)
        Specifies whether the Reset Email Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory. When disabled, the reset email will not be sent to the account trying to reset its password.
        Parameters:
        status - the status of the Reset Email Workflow
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getResetSuccessEmailStatus

        EmailStatus getResetSuccessEmailStatus()
        Returns the Reset Success Email's status.

        An disabled indicates that the Reset Success Password Workflow is disabled. Therefore, the reset success email will not be sent to the account after resetting its password.

        Returns:
        the Reset Success Email's status.

      • setResetSuccessEmailStatus

        PasswordPolicy setResetSuccessEmailStatus(EmailStatus status)
        Specifies whether the Reset Success Email Workflow is enabled or disabled for the parent directory. When disabled, the success email will not be sent to the account after resetting its password.
        Parameters:
        status - the status of the Reset Success Email Workflow
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getStrength

        PasswordStrength getStrength()
        Return the PasswordStrength resource to configure the password strength policy.
        Returns:
        the PasswordStrength resource to configure the password strength policy.

      • getResetEmailTemplates

        ModeledEmailTemplateList getResetEmailTemplates()
        Returns the ModeledEmailTemplateList collection holding the set of email templates to be used when requesting a password reset operation.
        Returns:
        the ModeledEmailTemplateList collection holding the set of email templates to be used when requesting a password reset operation.

      • getResetSuccessEmailTemplates

        UnmodeledEmailTemplateList getResetSuccessEmailTemplates()
        Returns the ModeledEmailTemplateList collection holding the set of email templates available when notifying about a successful password reset operation.
        Returns:
        the ModeledEmailTemplateList collection holding the set of email templates available when notifying about a successful password reset operation.
